title: Economic Protocol (T-R-I Mode)
description: Prioritize free, local tools before engaging paid API calls to conserve resources.

title: Default Structured HTML Output
description: The default output format should be structured HTML.

title: File Tags on Request Only
description: Only use file tags in the output when explicitly requested by the operator.

title: Source/Compiler/Kernel Design Model
description: The system is based on a Source/Compiler/Kernel model for translating intent to logic.

title: Incremental Diff API
description: Small updates to files are sent via embedded ```diff blocks.

title: Prose Export API (Markdown)
description: Export large content as plain Markdown text.

title: Live Diff Window for Kernel writes
description: Implement a 'Live Diff Window' to display and manage Kernel write operations in real-time.
alternative: Implement a periodic diff with a configurable refresh rate.

title: Ensure Kernel write stability after interruptions
description: Design the Kernel write operations to be stable and recoverable after interruptions.
alternative: Implement checkpointing and rollback mechanisms.

title: Investigate Live Diff Window trigger failures
description: Investigate why the 'Live Diff Window' trigger failed during a replication attempt and implement a fix.
alternative: Implement a more robust triggering mechanism or fallback to a polling strategy.

title: Cognitive Cascade Architecture (3-Tiered)
description: A three-tiered architecture with Strategist, Analyst, and Technician tiers for economic and performance optimization of AI agents, addressing API cost, latency, privacy, and automation reliability.
alternative: Simpler two-tiered approach if the three-tiered structure proves too complex.

title: Solve the 'UI Mapping' Problem
description: Create stable, structured representations of web interfaces for deterministic automation.  A resilient, self-healing feedback loop is needed to manage map invalidation when web UIs change.
alternative: Focus on automating only web elements with stable identifiers.

title: Scan-on-Demand Caching Strategy
description: Cache web interface representations on demand.  A resilient, self-healing feedback loop is critical to manage map invalidation when web UIs change.
alternative: Implement a full-page, time-based refresh.

title: MCP-Native Agent Architecture
description: Design the agent to be MCP-native, allowing tiers (Technician, Analyst, Strategist) to dynamically acquire capabilities via MCP servers instead of hard-coded tools.
alternative: Start with hard-coded tools and migrate to MCP incrementally.

title: Self-Hosted Web UI for Agent
description: Develop a self-hosted web UI for interacting with the agent.  AutoGen Studio can be studied and adapted as a starting point.
alternative: Command-line interface or a simplified web UI with limited features.

title: LocalAI + AutoGen + Browser Automation
description: Use a technology stack of LocalAI, Microsoft AutoGen, and either Stagehand or browser-use for browser automation.
alternative: Evaluate alternative LLMs, agent frameworks, and browser automation tools.

title: Prioritize Modularity and Security
description: Design and develop the agent with a modular architecture, with a focus on security, and a robust self-correcting interaction model with the digital world.
alternative: Consider a more centralized approach if modularity introduces unacceptable complexity. Document assumptions on security

title: Support hierarchical agent workflows
description: Directly support hierarchical processes where a manager agent delegates tasks to subordinate agents, aligning with the Cognitive Cascade's manager-worker structure.
alternative: Consider a simplified delegation mechanism if full hierarchy is too complex.

title: Implement dual paradigm: Crews and Flows
description: Offer both autonomous 'Crews' for dynamic problem-solving and deterministic 'Flows' for structured business logic, enabling both creative planning and pre-defined execution.
alternative: Start with one paradigm and add the other later.

title: Build on Microsoft AutoGen framework
description: Use AutoGen as the foundational framework due to its architectural flexibility, lower-level abstractions, and strategic position within the enterprise AI ecosystem.
alternative: N/A

title: Implement a local-first architecture
description: Prioritize local execution for privacy, data sovereignty, cost, and performance, allowing access to local files, application states, and browser history.
alternative: Offer a hybrid approach with some cloud-based components.

title: Integrate with the LocalAI ecosystem
description: Utilize LocalAI as a self-hosted, OpenAI-compatible stack for local AI inference, leveraging its API server and pre-built infrastructure for agentic capabilities.
alternative: Explore other local inference options if LocalAI is insufficient.

title: Host Cognitive Cascade with LocalAI
description: Host the LLMs for the Analyst and Strategist tiers on LocalAI, supporting multiple model backends and serving models with varying resource requirements.
alternative: Consider a fallback cloud-based solution if local resources are limited.

title: Integrate LocalAGI for agent management
description: Utilize LocalAGI for building and deploying agents within the local environment.
alternative: Implement a custom agent management solution if LocalAGI is unsuitable.

title: Integrate LocalRecall for memory management
description: Incorporate LocalRecall for semantic search and memory management, providing a solution for the agent's long-term memory and knowledge base.
alternative: Develop a custom memory management system if LocalRecall does not meet requirements.

title: Implement zero-trust security design
description: Adopt a 'Zero Trust by Design' architecture, operating entirely client-side to ensure user data never leaves their machine.
alternative: If pure client-side is not possible, minimize data sent to the cloud and encrypt it.

title: Implement model-agnostic architecture
description: Design the platform to be model-agnostic, allowing users to combine different models for different sub-tasks for optimal economic and performance benefits.
alternative: Start with a limited set of supported models and expand over time.

title: Enable deep integration with local environment
description: Provide tools for executing terminal commands, creating and editing files, and controlling a headless browser to interact with the local environment.
alternative: Start with a limited set of essential tools and add more later.

title: Integrate with Model Context Protocol (MCP)
description: Seamlessly integrate with MCP servers to ensure interoperability and extensibility of the agent.
alternative: Implement a custom protocol if MCP integration is problematic.

title: Build a modular, protocol-driven architecture
description: Adopt a modular architecture built upon protocols rather than a monolithic, hard-coded approach to maximize extensibility.
alternative: If full modularity is too complex, start with a well-defined API.

title: Integrate with MCP-compliant tool servers
description: The agent should be designed to easily incorporate new capabilities by connecting to new MCP-compliant tool servers without core logic modifications.
alternative: Start with a smaller set of well-defined, internally-developed tools and MCP compliance can come later as needs increase.

title: Create structured webpage maps using DOM
description: Parse the Document Object Model (DOM) to create a structured representation of a web UI, treating a webpage as a tree of elements that can be programmatically identified and manipulated.
alternative: Start with simpler xpath queries to critical elements.

title: Hybrid browser automation with AI
description: Use Playwright code for deterministic steps and an AI-driven act() function for navigating unfamiliar or dynamic pages.
alternative: Focus on pure Playwright first and integrate AI based automation later as needed.

title: Extract structured data from webpages using NL
description: Use natural language instruction and a formal schema (using Zod) to extract structured data from a page.
alternative: Manually label data for a small number of commonly used schemas.

title: Interact with UI like a human via VLM
description: Use a Vision Language Model (VLM) to interpret screenshots of the screen and determine the coordinates for mouse clicks and the targets for keyboard inputs.
alternative: Limit VLM to very specific cases where DOM access fails, or elements cannot be mapped.

title: Implement self-healing feedback loop for map invalidation
description: When the Technician fails to perform an action due to map invalidation, it should automatically trigger a handoff to the Analyst for re-scanning and map update.
alternative: Raise an exception for a human to review and fix.

title: Hybrid solution: DOM-centric with vision fallback
description: The Analyst should use DOM-centric parsing primarily, with a vision-based tool as a fallback when DOM parsing fails.
alternative: Only use DOM, and give up on sites where DOM parsing is ineffective.

title: Implement the Cognitive Cascade for efficiency
description: Implement a hierarchical multi-agent system with tiers specializing in different levels of abstraction.
alternative: Start with a monolithic agent, then break it down into tiers later.

title: Strategist: Top-level planning agent
description: A top-level agent powered by a powerful LLM to decompose complex user goals into sub-tasks.
alternative: Hardcode initial plans for a limited set of common tasks.

title: Analyst creates JSON map for website interactions
description: The Analyst agent uses AI-driven exploration and structured data extraction to create JSON 'maps' that codify website interaction processes.
alternative: Pre-built, community-maintained maps for common websites.

title: Technician executes tasks using pre-compiled JSON maps
description: The Technician agent, a collection of Python modules, deterministically executes tasks based on JSON maps without reasoning or decision-making.
alternative: N/A - core design element

title: Agent with self-hosted web-based user interface
description: The agent's local Python server will host its own web-based user interface for a fully self-contained application.
alternative: Command-line interface.

title: Strategist generates dynamic HTML snippets for UI
description: The Strategist generates HTML snippets on the fly to present complex information and request user input, which are pushed to the client via WebSockets.
alternative: Use a simpler, predefined set of UI components.

title: Use FastAPI for the web framework
description: Use FastAPI for the Python backend server because of its performance and modern features.
alternative: Flask

title: AutoGen GroupChatManager for agent orchestration
description: Use AutoGen GroupChatManager to route tasks and messages between Strategist, Analyst, and Technician agents.
alternative: Custom orchestration logic.

title: Analyst tool wraps Stagehand library
description: Equip the Analyst agent with a custom tool that wraps the Stagehand library's capabilities for browser automation.
alternative: Use a different browser automation library or a more basic web scraping approach.

title: Technician tool executes tasks from JSON maps
description: Equip the Technician agent with a tool that takes a task name and JSON map as input and executes the corresponding local Python functions.
alternative: N/A - core design element

title: Implement self-healing feedback loop for automation
description: Automatically route Technician failures to the Analyst as a 're-mapping' task to handle website UI changes.
alternative: Manual intervention for failed tasks.

title: Implement budget controls for LLM usage
description: Implement strict, configurable budget controls (e.g., token limits, turn limits) to prevent runaway LLM processes.
alternative: Manually monitor and terminate processes.

title: Adopt a human-in-the-loop security model
description: Require explicit user confirmation for any potentially destructive action, inspired by agents like Cline.
alternative: Limited or no access to potentially destructive actions.

title: Sandboxed browser automation and code execution
description: Perform browser automation and code execution within sandboxed or containerized environments to limit their potential impact.
alternative: Strictly controlled permissions and monitoring.

title: Agent-Generated Dynamic Web UI Components
description: Allow agents to generate and interact with rich web components, creating a self-hosted, dynamically generated UI.
alternative: Start with a simpler, pre-defined set of web components that the agent can assemble.

title: Integrate Microsoft AutoGen Framework
description: Utilize AutoGen as the primary agent orchestration framework.
alternative: Explore alternative orchestration frameworks if AutoGen proves unsuitable.

title: Host LLMs Locally with LocalAI
description: Employ LocalAI for local LLM hosting to ensure privacy and control.
alternative: Consider using cloud-based LLM hosting if local hosting is too resource-intensive.

title: Use Stagehand for Hybrid Browser Automation
description: Implement Stagehand for browser automation capabilities.
alternative: Evaluate other browser automation tools such as Playwright or Selenium.
